description: Describe previous term from the right (method A - initial term is 0).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..21
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Look and Say Sequence
formula: For n > 1: a(n+1) = A045918(A004086(a(n))). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 02 2014
example: E.g. the term after 1011 is obtained by saying "two 1's, one 0, one 1", which gives 211011.
prog: (Haskell)a022506 n = a022506_list !! na022506_list = 0 : 10 : iterate (a045918 . a004086) 1011-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 02 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
